title: Probably the worst thing about the new Swain...
body: His Soul Shards have _zero_ impact on how he's played outside of the damage scaling on his ultimate. You would think that for a guy who gains them from enemy deaths, hitting his slow-as-bologna W, or his passive would be able to use them in some meaningful way outside of determining if his ultimate his piss-poor or decent damage. At least with Syndra's orbs you can objectively tell who the better player is based on the ball juggling and management. Swain is just balanced around always having five shards so he can die when team fights happen.

replies.body: His W is useless in my opinion

In organised play on paper, it's busted as hell. You could hand off blue without him ever leaving the lane and it allows him to scout out the enemy jungler. The vision alone is a powerful ability.

But in casual play, it's only useful if you hit your E or if your target is heavily slowed or under hard CC. You don't even need a mobility spell to dodge it.

I find that its best use is as a zoning tool. Like if someone on the other team is being chased, I can say "no, you can't walk through here."

Give it time. The delay is huge, but pretty necessary to balance the incredible range. Players will figure out uses for it.
will be great for otps
His w has use, is it worth the the mana cost and cooldown for what it does(or fails to do)? Nope.

Riot Logic:  Hey, {{champion:50}}  needs an update.  People don't like how looks and his kit is outdated.  How about we delete him and create a new badass champ who plays kinda like vlad but looks like Count Dooku with some crow shit?  That would be great!

Is it really that different? I didn't play Swain much before, but his ultimate still allows him to drain tank, he still has a root that requires setup to land, and a conditional zone control slow.  He definitely doesn't deal as much DoT as he used to, but his Q can be used fairly often and gives decent DPS if used up close. His physical appearance definitely took a bit of a turn, and I think they could've done more to keep him visually away from Vlad (green demon energy instead of red, shorter hair, kept his clothes more similar to before). Overall though he still appears to fill the same role and do roughly the same things, just in a more interactive way for both players, which is basically the goal of VGUs. If you compare it to the Sion rework, new Sion doesn't function at all like he used to and while I love the new Sion and hated the old one there is definitely an argument that they just deleted the old character and made a new one.

I don't think they should have given him green magic at all. The new Swain's magic lines him up with the colors associated with Noxus - Red and Black. It makes a lot of sense that his magic and general look exhibits these colors prominently. Darius, Sion, and Katarina, some of the most prominent Noxians, also heavily use this color scheme, as does Vladimir and Elise, two lesser Noxians.

It's exactly why most of Jarvan IV's abilities tend to be on the Gold, White, and Blue side, as well as those of Xin Zhao, Fiora, Garen, and Galio.
I didn't think of it like that, fair point. Still hate the hair but in that context the rest of the changes make more sense.
As much as I love the update, this wasn't an opportunity to update Swain but rather to see how cool of a ruthless warlock dictator they could make.
